sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"注意"之意。
means: notice ： 指对所见所闻所感的人或事作出的反应，侧重结果。
note语气比notice强，指不仅注意到，而且记录下来，侧重注意的认真与仔细。
mind ： 指用心地去观察，了解某人或某物以达到某一目的。常用于命令句中。
attend ： 一般用词，侧重专心于某事。
remark ： 一般指经过思维活动而注意到。

sentence.Network_en: Precious few homebuyers will notice any reduction in their monthly repayments.
sentence.Network_cn: 极少数购房者会注意到他们月还款额的减少。

sentence.Network_en: It's not a case of whether anyone would notice or not.
sentence.Network_cn: 这不是会不会有人注意到的问题。

sentence.Network_en: Interest is paid monthly. Three months' notice is required for withdrawals.
sentence.Network_cn: 利息按月支付。提款须提前3个月通知银行。

jx.jx_en_mean: with little warning or time for preparation
jx.jx_cn_mean: 临时通知，提前很短时间通知

lj.lj_ly: tours may be cancelled at short notice.
lj.lj_ls: 旅行可能会临时通知取消。

phrase.cizu_name: put someone on notice (或 serve notice)

jx.jx_en_mean: warn someone of something about or likely to occur, especially in a formal or threatening manner
jx.jx_cn_mean: 正式警告（某人某事将会或可能发生）；正告

lj.lj_ly: we're going to put foreign governments on notice that we want a change of trade policy.
lj.lj_ls: 我们将要警告外国政府我们要改变贸易政策。

jx.jx_en_mean: pay no attention to someone or something
pay attention; show signs of interest

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in sense 2): from Old French, from Latin notitia 'being known', from notus 'known' (see notion)

entry.def: If you notice something or someone, you become aware of them.

example.ex: People should not hesitate to contact the police if they've noticed anyone acting suspiciously...
example.tran: 如果发现形迹可疑的人，应该马上报警。

example.ex: I noticed that most academics were writing papers during the summer...
example.tran: 我注意到大部分学者暑期都在写论文。

entry.def: A notice is a written announcement in a place where everyone can read it.

example.ex: Notices in the waiting room requested that you neither smoke nor spit...
example.tran: 候车室的公告牌要求人们不要吸烟和随地吐痰。

example.ex: A few guest houses had 'No Vacancies' notices in their windows.
example.tran: 有几家旅社在窗户上贴出了“客满”的告示。

entry.def: If you give notice about something that is going to happen, you give a warning in advance that it is going to happen.

example.ex: Interest is paid monthly. Three months' notice is required for withdrawals...
example.tran: 利息按月支付。提款须提前3个月通知银行。

example.ex: Unions are required to give seven days' notice of industrial action...
example.tran: 工会组织劳工行动应提前7天作出声明。

entry.def: A notice is a formal announcement in a newspaper or magazine about something that has happened or is going to happen.

example.ex: I rang The Globe with news of Blake's death, and put notices in the personal column of The Times...
example.tran: 我给环球剧院打电话告知了布莱克的死讯，然后在《泰晤士报》的私人广告栏登了讣告。

example.ex: The request is published in notices in today's national newspapers.
example.tran: 这一请求刊登在今天全国各大报纸的启事栏里。

entry.tran: (机构发送给相关人员的)通告
entry.def: A notice is one of a number of letters that are similar or exactly the same which an organization sends to people in order to give them information or ask them to do something.

example.ex: Bonus notices were issued each year from head office to local agents...
example.tran: 分红通告每年由总公司发送至地方代理商。

example.ex: There will be a creditors meeting on June 15 and notices will be circulated to all known creditors.
example.tran: 6月15号有一个债权人会议，通告将送达所有已知的债权人。

entry.tran: (报刊上关于戏剧、电影或音乐会的)短评，评论
entry.def: A notice is a written article in a newspaper or magazine in which someone gives their opinion of a play, film, or concert.

example.ex: Nevertheless, it's good to know you've had good notices, even if you don't read them.
example.tran: 不过，即便你不看，知道有一些对你的好评也挺好。

entry.tran: 随时/接到通知后立即/提前24小时通知
entry.def: Notice is used in expressions such as 'at short notice', 'at a moment's notice' or 'at twenty-four hours' notice', to indicate that something can or must be done within a short period of time.

example.ex: There's no one available at such short notice to take her class...
example.tran: 只提前这么短的时间通知，找不到人替她的课。

example.ex: All our things stayed in our suitcase, as if we had to leave at a moment's notice.
example.tran: 我们的东西都放在手提箱里，好像我们一经通知就得马上离开。

entry.tran: 引起(某人)对…的注意;使(某人)察觉到
entry.def: If you bring something to someone's notice, you make them aware of it.

example.ex: I am so glad that you have brought this to my notice...
example.tran: 我很高兴你让我注意到了这件事情。

example.ex: It was in 1982 that his name was first brought to our notice.
example.tran: 他的名字第一次引起我们注意是在1982年。

entry.def: If something comes to your notice, you become aware of it.

example.ex: Her work also came to the notice of the French actor-producer Louis Jouvet...
example.tran: 她的作品也引起了法国演员兼制片人路易·茹韦的注意。

example.ex: As I write, a very interesting case has come to my notice.
example.tran: 在我写作过程中，一个非常有趣的案例引起了我的注意。

entry.tran: 没有引起…注意;没有被…察觉
entry.def: If something escapes your notice, you fail to recognize it or realize it.

example.ex: It hasn't escaped our notice that the hospital has come out of all the proposed changes really quite nicely...
example.tran: 我们注意到医院很好地兑现了所有拟议的变革举措。

example.ex: From the smallest to the largest production unit, no one escaped notice.
example.tran: 从最小的到最大的生产单位，全都在监控之下。

entry.def: If a situation is said to exist until further notice, it will continue for an uncertain length of time until someone changes it.

example.ex: All flights to Lanchow had been cancelled until further notice.
example.tran: 所有飞往兰州的航班都已取消，何时恢复另行通知。

entry.def: If an employer gives an employee notice, the employer tells the employee that he or she must leave his or her job within a fixed period of time.

example.ex: The next morning I telephoned him and gave him his notice.
example.tran: 第二天早晨我给他打了电话，通知他已被解雇。

entry.def: If you hand in your notice or give in your notice, you tell your employer that you intend to leave your job soon within a set period of time.

example.ex: He handed in his notice at the bank and ruined his promising career.
example.tran: 他向银行提出了辞职，毁掉了自己的大好前程。

entry.def: If you take notice of a particular fact or situation, you behave in a way that shows that you are aware of it.

example.ex: We want the government to take notice of what we think they should do for single parents...
example.tran: 我们希望政府能够关注单亲父母，为他们做一些应该做的事。

example.ex: This should make people sit up and take notice.
example.tran: 这件事应引起人们的关注。

entry.def: If you take no notice of someone or something, you do not consider them to be important enough to affect what you think or what you do.

example.ex: They took no notice of him, he did not stand out, he was in no way remarkable...
example.tran: 他们没在意他，他并不突出，一点也不引人注目。

example.ex: I tried not to take any notice at first but then I was offended by it.
example.tran: 起初我尽量不予理会，但后来我被惹恼了。

means.word_mean: 1. an announcement containing information about a future event;
2. the act of noticing or paying attention;

sentences.sentence: "he escaped the notice of the police"
"the notification stated the grace period and the penalties for defaulting"

means.word_mean: 4. advance notification (usually written) of the intention to withdraw from an arrangement or contract;

sentences.sentence: "we received a notice to vacate the premises"
"he gave notice two months before he moved"

means.word_mean: 5. a sign posted in a public place as an advertisement;

sentences.sentence: "his hard work soon attracted the teacher's notice"

means.word_mean: 1. discover or determine the existence, presence, or fact of;

sentences.sentence: "She detected high levels of lead in her drinking water"
"We found traces of lead in the paint"
"She noted that someone was following her"

means.word_mean: 3. make or write a comment on;

sentences.sentence: "he commented the paper of his colleague"

means.word_mean: 4. express recognition of the presence or existence of, or acquaintance with;

sentences.sentence: "He never acknowledges his colleagues when they run into him in the hallway"
"She acknowledged his complement with a smile"
"it is important to acknowledge the work of others in one's own writing"

auth_sentence.content: Tastes adapt - and people simply don't notice.
auth_sentence.res_content: Tastes adapt - and people simply don't notice.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Tastes adapt - and people simply don't notice.

auth_sentence.content: But with Foxtrot everyone had begun to take notice.
auth_sentence.res_content: But with Foxtrot everyone had begun to take notice.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But with Foxtrot everyone had begun to take notice.

auth_sentence.content: Few will notice; few are talking about it.
auth_sentence.res_content: Few will notice; few are talking about it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Few will notice; few are talking about it.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 显而易见的, 值得注意的
stems_affixes.word_buile: notice注意到,注意+able……的→adj.显而易见的, 值得注意的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 臭名昭著的,声名狼藉的
stems_affixes.word_buile: not知道,注意,注释+orious多……的→多惹人注意的→臭名昭著的
notorious[[adj.臭名昭著的,声名狼藉的]]→n.臭名昭彰
denote[v.指示,表示,意味着]+ation表名词→n.指示

stems_affixes.value_cn: 值得注意的,显著的,著名的
stems_affixes.word_buile: not知道,注意,注释+able能……的→n.值得注意的,显著的,著名的
not知道,注意,注释+e→n.笔记；注释 v.注意到
note笔记+book→n.笔记簿, 笔记本

stems_affixes.value_cn: 通知,通告,布告;注意,认识
stems_affixes.word_buile: not知道,注意,注释+ice表名词→n.通知,通告,布告;注意,认识 v.注意到,注意

stems_affixes.value_cn: 概念,想法,意念,看法,观点
stems_affixes.word_buile: not知道,注意,注释+ion表名词→n.概念,想法,意念,看法,观点
de加强+not知道,注意,注释+e→指示
not知道,注意,注释+e→n.笔记；注释 v.注意到
not知道,注意,注释+ify表动词→给以注意→通知
not知道,注意,注释+ice表名词→n.通知,通告,布告;注意,认识 v.注意到,注意

Sentence.sentence: I didn't notice it when I came in.
In fact, we are much more likely to notice departures from norms than conformity to them.
But then most of communication operates without being noticed.
During the 1980s he noticed an increasing number of long poems among the submissions, with some running to 70 or 80 pages.
Tom, one of the things visitor notices about Harrogate is the large area of open park land right down into the middle of the town.

sentences.en: These rules are subject to change without notice.
sentences.cn: 这些规则可不经通知就进行更改。

means.word_mean: 布告, 通告, 启示

sentences.en: They announced the birth of their baby by putting a notice in the newspaper.
sentences.cn: 他们在报纸上刊登启示, 宣告他们婴儿的诞生。

sentences.en: Nobody took notice of the mischief of the matter.
sentences.cn: 没有人注意到这件事情所带来的危害。

means.word_mean: (文学作品、电影、电视剧等的)短评；简介；评价

sentences.en: The new play got mixed notices.
sentences.cn: 这一新剧得到的评价是褒贬不一。

sentences.en: I didn't notice you when you passed by.
sentences.cn: 你走过时, 我没有注意到你。

sentences.en: We noticed how to make the experiment.
sentences.cn: 我们注意如何做这个实验。

sentences.en: The teacher noticed that one student was missing.
sentences.cn: 老师发现一个学生不见了。

sentences.en: I noticed how she did it.
sentences.cn: 我注意到了她是怎么做这件事的。

sentences.en: I noticed the man leaving the house.
sentences.cn: 我注意到那人离开这栋房子。

sentences.en: She noticed him merely with a nod.
sentences.cn: 她仅以点头向他打招呼。

sentences.en: He noticed you and your team for several times in his remarks.
sentences.cn: 他在讲话中曾多次提到你和你的小组。

sentences.en: The government has noticed us to quit out of the old building.
sentences.cn: 政府已通知我们迁出这座旧大楼。

jushi.english: They took no notice of these rumours.
jushi.chinese: 他们没有留心这些谣言。

jushi.english: I'm fed up with this job,I'm giving in my notice tomorrow.
jushi.chinese: 我对这个工作极其厌烦,明天我就交辞职通知书。

jushi.english: If you want to reserve a room you have to give them a few days' notice.
jushi.chinese: 如果你要预订房间,就要提前几天通知我们。
